newsitem.title: INDIA: India copper joins zinc, lead on downtrend.
newsitem.headline: India copper joins zinc, lead on downtrend.

text.p: Copper joined zinc and lead prices headed lower on the local Indian market, while other base metals held steady in quiet trading, dealers said.
"Zinc and lead extended losses amid lower than expected industrial buying while fresh arrivals from the producers dragged prices lower," said Sharad Parikh, president of Bombay Metal Exchange.
Zinc fell by 50 rupees at 7,750 rupees per quintal after losing 50 rupees on Tuesday while lead slid by 50 rupees at 4,200 rupees per quintal after losing 100 rupees on Tuesday.
Copper moved down by 50 rupees at 13,450 rupees while aluminium was indicated at the previous level of 7,450 rupees per quintal amid nominal trading.
"Tin was steady at 31,200 rupees as was nickel at 36,100 rupees per quintal but the undertone was subdued amid poor buying enquiries," Parikh added.
Bombay metal market will remain closed on Thursday for birth anniversary of king Shivaji. Market will reopen on Friday.
